column4: hello all... anyone here who can help me with changing the default permissions on Ubuntus automount drives (inserting a usbstick) ?
It's usually in Nautilus, System > Prefrences > File Management
dont seem to have any "File Management" there ?
open Nautlius and then Edit > Preferences.
cant see what exactly im looking for there
isn't that what you're asking help for?
no, i might have been a bit unclear... i was looking for at way to give all users access to my USB-stick when it get automountet after i insert it
you should put everyone under a certain group 'automount' and allow them access to mount and unmount drives.
It's in the Users and Groups preference.
hmm... i can create the group but i see no way of setting any group rules in there
anyway i could use it if i just could give the www-data user access to any automountet usb that i have inserted
but i dont see the www-data user in the user/group management
I don't know *too much* about account administration in Linux.
any idea what file i have to look in to change the www-date users group or permission settings instead ?
no, sorry. Try searching the forums.
ok... but thanks for the help anyway ;-)
